CatDescriptText: Doris "Dorie" Miller received the Navy Cross on May 27, 1942, at Pearl Harbor, for his courage on the sinking ship U.S.S. West Virginia.  He was the first African-American to receive the honor.  He was killed in action in 1943. In 1973, U.S.S. Miller was named in honor of Doris Miller.
TitMainTitle: Copy of a photograph of Admiral Chester W. Nimitz pinning the Navy Cross on Mess Attendant Second Class Doris "Dorie" Miller at Pearl Harbor
